abstract: Op-Ed article by author Beth Macy examines concerns of working class Americans as Trans-Pacific Partnership nears completion; reviews economic devastation in Virginia after loss of 300,000 American furniture-making jobs following previous trade liberalization and China's admission into World Trade Organization; questions how many more manufacturing jobs will be lost following new trade pacts, arguing that voice of workers has been drowned out at policy-making level by corporate influence.
lead_paragraph: As the T.P.P. moves through Congress, factory workers whose jobs have vanished don’t know who’s looking out for them.

headline.main: Who’s Speaking Up for the American Worker?
headline.print_headline: Who’s Speaking Up for the American Worker?
